column4: I want to thank Dr. Asif Mahmood for his advice on matters of public health, human rights and international relations. His attention to issues affecting Uighurs, Kashmiris and Rohingya, shed light on the experiences of those peoples.

(5/5) Masking protects Americans from unnecessary identification in intelligence docs when they aren‚Äôt doing things like running a secret lobbying operation on behalf of a foreign government. Masking is not meant to protect people like #Flynn.

(3/5) It turns out that one of the officials that sought #Unmasking that ultimately IDed #Flynn was the US Ambassador to Turkey. It would seem helpful to know (i.e. through whom) a country was trying to influence the US government. 
https://t.co/x6qaJiNyef

(2/5)

3) The people requesting that identities be #Unmasked can‚Äôt know ahead of time who they would be getting ‚Äúdirt‚Äù on anyway. You can‚Äôt intend to smear someone in particular if you don‚Äôt know who you‚Äôd be smearing.

(1/5) The ‚Äúcontroversy‚Äù over the #UnmaskingFlynn requests is completely manufactured. 

1) Such requests are routine. 

2) When an American is unmasked it‚Äôs not as though people can go public with the info to attack the American (it‚Äôs still going to be classified).

(1/3) Earlier today I spoke on the House Floor in support of the #Coronavirus Aid, Relief, & Economic Security Act: 

"This virus is a machine gun, firing at America. This bill provides $2 trillion to bandage some of the wounds. We must stop the machine gun...

Just boarded a red eye flight to Baltimore airport, heading back to DC to ensure we have enough Members if we need a quorum & need to vote on the #coronavirus relief bill. It‚Äôs not a perfect bill, but @HouseDemocrats fought to ensure we took care of workers & put #FamiliesFirst.

I support the Senate compromise bill & will vote for it if a formal vote is called. Unfortunately, it does virtually nothing to develop treatment or vaccines. It‚Äôs imperfect. It‚Äôs a compromise. Next week we should pass a bill to fund & incentivize #coronavirus medical research.

Asian Americans are increasingly the target of racist attacks as #COVID19 spreads. Asian Americans are not to blame, & many are on the frontlines fighting it as doctors, researchers & 1st responders. I signed @RepGraceMeng's resolution to condemn this hate & protect all Americans

(3/3) It‚Äôs time to both fund & incentivize all possibly useful approaches to improve testing methodologies, provide treatments, & develop vaccines. Our preexisting laws do a lot, & the billion we provided this month is good. But we need to do more, hopefully in the fourth bill.

(2/3) I support the big stimulus bill, if it‚Äôs drafted well & gives big aid to families. But we must remember:
